titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Samuel Cheever, Josiah Tiffany, and Alonzo G. Hammond commission 1974.160
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:18:56 +0000.

did.unittitle: Samuel Cheever, Josiah Tiffany, and Alonzo G. Hammond commission
did.abstract: A commission issued by the State of New York to Samuel Cheever, Josiah Tiffany, and Alonzo G. Hammond, appointing them as commissioners to carry out duties related to laying out streets and avenues in the City of Brooklyn. The document indicates that this is a duplicate copy of the official commission.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Samuel Cheever, Josiah Tiffany, and Alonzo G. Hammond commission, 1974.160, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
